value.title: The COALESCE function in Power BI DAX
value.excerpt: In this vLog, we will talk about the COALESCE function in Power BI Dax. COALESCE function accepts multiple arguments and returns the first argument that is nonblank.  The SQL users are aware of this COALESCE function. We have the now DAX function equivalent of SQL COALESCE.   In this video, we will talk

value.title: Explicit Vs Implicit DAX Measures in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you ever tried to connect to a Power BI dataset from Excel using Analyze in Excel? if yes, you might have had this experience that your values don’t show in Excel’s Pivot table as values. value.title: Power BI Modeling Tip   Snapshot Table or DAX Measures
value.excerpt: I often get this question: “Is it better that I create this calculation as a snapshot table in Power Query (or T-SQL, or the data source), or write DAX measures for it?” If you ever had a scenario of creating a report of snapshots, you know what I mean. “Should I have a table for inventory stock on hand

value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX.
